string:
In INDIA: #linkedBlock
In terms of area, Rajasthan is the largest state and Goa is the smallest. 
In terms of population, Uttar Pradesh is the largest and Sikkim is the smallest.

🔹 The Keibul Lamjao National Park in Manipur, India, is the world's only floating national park. It is situated on Loktak Lake. 
🔹 The Floating Post Office is located on Dal Lake in Srinagar, India. 
🔹 Russia has a floating nuclear power plant called the Akademik Lomonosov.  #linkedBlock

**Indian Land Border:** #linkedBlock
Watch {video:IwIGTOmTniQ:0}

India shared land border **with 7 countries**:
Bangladesh > China > Pakistan > Nepal > Myanmar > Bhutan > Afghanistan
--
Bangladesh shares the longest border with India.
Afghanistan shares the smallest.
![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2Froamprep%2FtCOgD_esqC.png?alt=media&token=ed917f5e-fdaf-4a9a-8c36-0c93f171980a)

🔹  Highest peak in the world: Mount Everest, located in Nepal.
🔹  Highest peak in India (disputed): K2 (Godwin Austen), in the Karakoram range, located in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir.
So when asked highest peal in India then it is "K2", as PoK is Indian part. 
🔹  Highest peak in Indian territory: Kanchenjunga. #linkedBlock

Important Movements: #linkedBlock

**Bishnoi Movement:**
🔹 Founded in the 15th century by Guru Maharaj Jambaji in Rajasthan.
🔹 Known for nature reverence; protested tree felling in the 17th century.
🔹 Over 360 Bishnois, including Amrita Devi, died protecting trees.

**Chipko Movement:**
🔹 It was about plant conservation
🔹 Emerged in the 1970s in Uttarakhand.
Locals, especially women, hugged trees to stop logging.
🔹 Gained international recognition for non-violent forest conservation.


**Appiko Movement:**
🔹 Started in 1983 in Karnataka, inspired by Chipko.
"Appiko" means "to embrace" in Kannada; focused on hugging trees.
🔹 Halted tree felling in Kalse forests.


**Silent Valley Movement:**
🔹  In the 1970s in Kerala to protect Silent Valley rainforest.
🔹 Prevented a hydroelectric dam, preserving the ecosystem.

**Narmada Bachao Andolan (NBA):**
🔹 Began in the 1980s, led by Medha Patkar.
🔹 Opposed large dams on the Narmada River.
🔹 Highlighted displacement and environmental damage from development projects.

🔹  India's National Anthem, "Jana Gana Mana," was composed by Rabindranath Tagore.
🔹  India's National Song, "Vande Mataram," was written by Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay. #linkedBlock

States and their [[capital]]: #linkedBlock

**North East States and their Capitals:**
▪️ The eight North East states of India are Arunachal Pradesh (Itanagar), Assam (Dispur), Manipur (Imphal), Meghalaya (Shillong), Mizoram (Aizawl), Nagaland (Kohima), Sikkim (Gangtok), and Tripura (Agartala). 
▪️ These include the seven "Sister States" (Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, and Tripura) plus Sikkim.

![](https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/firescript-577a2.appspot.com/o/imgs%2Fapp%2Froamprep%2FLz48tG86fK.png?alt=media&token=3a0841ae-8474-4e73-a353-ea84a85ba766)

The **atomic number** is the number of protons in an atom's nucleus, while the **atomic mass** (also called mass number) is the total number of protons and neutrons in the nucleus. 

The atomic number defines the element, while the atomic mass can vary for isotopes of the same element.

**Isotopes:**
Atoms of the same element with the same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons.
Example: Carbon-12 (¹²C) and Carbon-14 (¹⁴C).
Both have 6 protons (same element: Carbon).
Carbon-12 has 6 neutrons, Carbon-14 has 8 neutrons.


**Isobars:**
Atoms of different elements with the same mass number but different numbers of protons and neutrons.
Example: Carbon-14 (¹⁴C) and Nitrogen-14 (¹⁴N).
Both have a mass number of 14 (protons + neutrons).
Carbon-14: 6 protons, 8 neutrons; Nitrogen-14: 7 protons, 7 neutrons. 
#linkedBlock

**Important International Organizations:**

**G20:**
🔹 Full Form: Group of Twenty.
🔹 Established: 1999.
🔹 Members: 20 (19 countries + European Union).
🔹 Headquarters: No permanent headquarters; secretariat rotates among member countries.


**G7:**
🔹 Full Form: Group of Seven.
🔹 Established: 1975.
🔹 Members (7): Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, UK, USA.
🔹 Headquarters: No permanent headquarters; meetings hosted by member countries on a rotating basis.


**SAARC:**
🔹 Full Form: South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation.
🔹 Established: 1985.
🔹 Members (8): Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka.
🔹 Headquarters: Kathmandu, Nepal.


**ASEAN:**
🔹 Full Form: Association of Southeast Asian Nations.
🔹 Established: 1967.
🔹 Members (10): Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam.
🔹 Headquarters: Jakarta, Indonesia.


**BIMSTEC:**
🔹 Full Form: Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation.
🔹 Established: 1997.
🔹 Members (7): Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Myanmar, Nepal, Sri Lanka, Thailand.
🔹 Headquarters: Dhaka, Bangladesh.


**ADB:**
🔹 Full Form: Asian Development Bank.
🔹 Established: 1966.
🔹 Members: 68 (49 regional, 19 non-regional).
🔹 Headquarters: Manila, Philippines.


**IMF:**
🔹 Full Form: International Monetary Fund.
🔹 Established: 1945.
🔹 Members: 190.
🔹 Headquarters: Washington, D.C., USA.
🔹  IMF and World Bank are together called as "twin institutes"

**World Bank:**
🔹 Full Form: World Bank Group.
🔹 Established: 1944.
🔹 Members: 189.
🔹 Headquarters: Washington, D.C., USA. 
#linkedBlock

**Freshwater on Earth** #linkedBlock
🔹 The Earth is a watery place. About 71% of the Earth's surface is water-covered, while the other 29% consists of continents and islands. 
🔹 96.5% of all the Earth's water is contained within the oceans as saltwater, while the remaining 3.5% is freshwater lakes and frozen water locked up in glaciers and the polar ice caps.
🔹 Water also exists in the air as water vapor, in rivers and lakes, in icecaps and glaciers, in the ground as soil moisture and in aquifers. 
🔹 The vast majority of water on the Earth's surface is saline water in the oceans. 

🔹 Over 68% of the freshwater on Earth is found in icecaps and glaciers
🔹 30 percent is found in groundwater. 
🔹 Only about 0.3 percent of our freshwater is found in the surface water of lakes, rivers, and swamps. 


🔹 The Antarctic ice sheet holds about 90 percent of the fresh water that exists on the Earth’s surface.
🔹 The ice sheet covers approximately 8.7 million square miles. 
🔹 The Greenland ice sheet also contains large volumes of fresh water. 
These two ice sheets account for more than 99 percent of the freshwater ice on the planet.


📅 **22 March** is celebrated as the world water day every year.
